text.__SUMMARY__: Imbricariopsis punctata, common name the bone-like mitre, is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Mitridae, the miters or miter snails.
text.Description: The length of the shell varies between 11 mm and 25 mm.
text.Distribution: This marine species occurs in the Indian Ocean off the Mascarenes, Aldabra]] and Réunion; off New Guinea
text.References: Poppe G.T. & Tagaro S.P. (2008). Mitridae. pp. 330–417, in: G.T. Poppe (ed.), Philippine marine mollusks, volume 2. Hackenheim: ConchBooks. 848 pp
